contentrichtext.text: {{Nihongo|'''Fukuyama'''|福山町|Fukuyama-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Aira District, Kagoshima|Aira District]], [[Kagoshima Prefecture|Kagoshima]], [[Japan]]. On November 7, 2005 Fukuyama was merged with the towns of [[Kirishima, Kagoshima (town)|Kirishima]] (old), [[Hayato, Kagoshima|Hayato]], [[Makizono, Kagoshima|Makizono]], [[Mizobe, Kagoshima|Mizobe]] and [[Yokogawa, Kagoshima|Yokogawa]], all from [[Aira District, Kagoshima|Aira District]], and the old city of [[Kokubu, Kagoshima|Kokubu]], to form the new city of [[Kirishima, Kagoshima|Kirishima]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipalities of Japan|municipality]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 7,209 and the [[population density|density]] of 105.21 persons per km². The total area was 68.52 km². ==External links== * [http://www.city-kirishima.jp/ Official website of Kirishima] {{Ja icon}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Kagoshima Prefecture]] {{Kagoshima-geo-stub}}
